gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm iskMDy bicqR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnvqwry cMfUr must ml bDih DXwie smwpqm sq ]
transliteration: It(i) Sridasam Sikandhe Bachitra Naatak Granthe Krishanavtdare Channdoor Moust Mal Badhah(i) Dhayaae Samaaptam Sat||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Killing of the wrestlers-Chandur and Mushitak” in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.
Now begins the description about the killing of Kansa

gurmukhi: mwr ley irp bIr doaU niRp qau mn BIqir kRoD BrXo ]ien ko Bt mwrhu Kyq AbY ieh BwNq khXo Ar Sor krXo ]
transliteration: Maar Lae Rip Beer Dooo Nrip Tau Man Bheetar(i) Krodh Bdaryo|| In Ko Bhat Daroh Khet Abai Eh Bhaant Kahyo Ar Shor Daryo||
translation: When both the brothers killed the enemies, the king was filled with rage; he, in great tumultuousness, said to his warriors, “Kill both of them just now;”

gurmukhi: jdurw BrQU qb pwn lgo Apny mn mY nhI nYku frXo ]joaU Awie prXo hir pY kupkY hir Qw pr so soaU mwr frXo ]850]
transliteration: Jaduraa Bharthoo Tab Paan Lago Apne Man Mai Nahinaik(u) Daryo|| Jooo Aae Daryo Har(i) Pai Koup-kai Har(i) Thaa Par So Sooo Maar Daryo||850||
translation: The king of the Yadavas (Krishna) and his brother, catching hand of each other, stood there fearlessly; whosoever fell upon them in fury, was killed at that place by Krishna and Balram.850.

gurmukhi: hir kUd qbY rMg BUmih qy niRp Qo su jhwN vh hI pgu DwrXo ]kMs leI kr Fwl sMBwr kY kop BrXo As KYNc inkwrXo ]
transliteration: Har(i) Kood Tabai Ran Bhoomah(i) Te Nrip Tho Su Jahaan Vh Hipag(u) Dhdaryo|| Kans Laikar Dhaal Sandhaar Kai Kop Bdaryo As Khainch Nikdaryo||
translation: Now, jumping from the stage, Krishna stabilized his feet at the place where king Kansa was seated; Kansa, in anger, controlling his shield, pulled out his sword and struck a blow on Krishna;

gurmukhi: daur deI iqh ky qn pY hir PwD gey Aiq dwv sMBwrXo ]kysn qy gih kY irp kO DrnI pr kY bl qwih pCwrXo ]851]
transliteration: Daur Daitih Ke Tan Pai Har(i) Phaadh Gad At(i) Daav Sanbhdaryo|| Kesan Te Gadh Kai Rip Kau Dharnidar Kai Bal Taah(i) Pachhdaryo||851||
translation: Krishna jumped away and saved himself from this stratagem; he caught hold of the enemy from his hair and with force dashed him on the ground.851.

gurmukhi: gih kysn qy ptkXo Dr soN gih gofn qy qb GIs dXo ]niRp mwr hulws bFXo ijX mY Aiq hI pur BIqr Sor pXo ]
transliteration: Gadh Kesan Te Patkyo Dhar Son Gadh Godan Te Tab Ghees Dayo Nrip Maar Hulaas Badhyo Jiya Mai At(i) Hibheetar Shor Payo||
translation: Catching hold of his hair, Krishna threw Kansa on the erth and catching his leg, he dragged him; killing the king Kansa, Krishna’s mind was filled with delight and on the other side there were loud lamentations in the palace;

gurmukhi: kib sXwm pRqwp ipKo hir ko ijn swDn rwK kY S`qR CXo ]kt bMDn qwq dey mn ky sB hI jg mY js vwih lXo ]852]
transliteration: Kabi Syaam Prataap Pikho Har(i) Ko Jin Saadhan Raakh Kai Shattra Chhayo|| Kaat Bandhan Taat Dae Man Ke Sabh Hijag Mai Jas Vaah(i) Layo||852||
translation: The poet says that the glory of Lord Krishna may be visualised, who has protected the saints and destroyed the enemies; he has broken the bondages of all and in this way, he has broken the bondages of all and in this way, he has been praised by the world.

gurmukhi: irp ko bD kY qb hir jU ibsrwq ky Gwt kY aUpr AwXo ]kMs ky bIr blI ju huqy iqn dyKq sXwm kO kop bfwXo ]
transliteration: Rip Ko Badh Kai Tab Har(i) Joo Bisraat Ke Ghaat Kai Oopar Aayo|| Kans Ke Beer Baliju Houte Tin Dekhat Syaam Kau Kop Badaayo||
translation: After killing the enemy, Krishna came on the ferry of Yamuna and when he saw there other warriors of Kansa, he was greatly enraged;

gurmukhi: so n gXo iqn pws iCmXo hir ky sMg Awie kY ju`Du mcwXo ]sXwm sMBwr qbY bl ko iqn ko DrnI pr mwir igrwXo ]853]
transliteration: So Na Gado Tin Paas Chhimyo Har(i) Ke San Aae Kai Juddh(u) Machadyo|| Syaam Sanbhaar Tabai Bal Ko Tin Ko Dharnidar Daar(i) Giraayo||853||
translation: He, who did not come to him, he was forgive, but still some warriors came and began to wage war with him; he sustaining his power, killed all of them.853.
